titleInfo.title: Brought to the Second Municipality Police Prison.

subject.geographic: Cotfield, twenty-five miles up the Coast

mods.abstract: BROUGHT to the Second Municipality Police Prison -- FREDERICK, a light griff, 4 feet 8 inches high, aged about 13 years, has lost two fingers at the second joint, off his right hand; says he belongs to Mr. Simons, of Lafayette, parish of Jefferson, La. SAM, a black, aged about 27 years, 5 feet 10 inches high, has a scar on the left eye, one on the right cheek, and one on the back of his right hand ; says he belongs to Mr. Jones, or Coffield, twenty-five miles up the Coast. JOHN, a dark griff, aged about 50 years, 5 feet 6 inches high, both thumbs stiff; says he belongs to Mr. Jones or Col. Whitehead, twenty-five miles up the Coast. JOHN, a dark griff, aged about 31 years, 5 feet 10 inches high, has a scar over his left eye ; says he belongs to Major Beard, of NewOrleans. SAM, a mulatto, aged about 55 years, 5 feet 8 inches high, has a scar on his left cheek, and the left hand crippled ; says he belongs to Mr. Perks, of NewOrleans. The owners will please comply with the law respecting them. J. WORRALL, Warden. NewOrleans, February 13, 1851. fe14 1aw3w
mods.note: light griff; black; dark griff; mulatto
Mr. Simons; Mr. Jones; Mr. Jones or Col. Whitehead; Major Beard; Mr. Perks

detail.title: New Orleans daily crescent. ([New Orleans, La.]) 1851-1866

mods.accessCondition: Please submit an LSU Special Collections reference ticket at https://askus.lib.lsu.edu/special for any questions or comments about this digital object.

Physical rights are retained by the LSU Libraries. Copyright has expired and the item is therefore in the public domain. Permission to reproduce this image must be requested through the Special Collections Department, Louisiana State University Libraries.
mods.note: Louisiana Runaway Slave Advertisements, 1836-1865, Louisiana Digital Library, Baton Rouge, La.
